str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
A prolonged form of nun for emphasis; just now.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: From kata and echo; to hold down, in various applications.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: From kata and argeo; to be entirely idle, literally or figuratively.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
To be a slave, be subject to, obey, be devoted. From doulos; to be a slave to.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Freshness, newness, novelty. From kainos; renewal.
Wind, breath, spirit.
And, even, also, namely.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Oldness, obsoleteness. From palaios; antiquatedness.
From grapho; a writing, i.e. A letter, note, epistle, book, etc. plural learning.
